title: Char Chinar Island – A Sacred Sunrise
excerpt: Located in the heart of Dal Lake, Char Chinar Island is a mystical place surrounded by ancient chinar trees. Practicing Surya Namaskar here, facing the towering Mahadev Peak, is a deeply rejuvenating experience.
author: Aryan Sharma
content: Located in the heart of Dal Lake, Char Chinar Island is a mystical place surrounded by ancient chinar trees. Practicing Surya Namaskar here, facing the towering Mahadev Peak, is a deeply rejuvenating experience. As the first rays of the sun bathe the island in golden light, the lake reflects the beauty of the moment, creating a profound sense of peace and spiritual connection.

title: Nishat Bagh – The Mughal Paradise
excerpt: Nishat Bagh, one of Kashmir's iconic Mughal Gardens, is a symbol of imperial grandeur. Overlooking Dal Lake, it features cascading terraces, flowing water channels, and fragrant flower beds.
author: Leila Patel
content: Nishat Bagh, one of Kashmir's iconic Mughal Gardens, is a symbol of imperial grandeur. Overlooking Dal Lake, it features cascading terraces, flowing water channels, and fragrant flower beds. Strolling through its paths is like stepping into a painting, with the majestic Zabarwan Range forming a breathtaking backdrop. Built by Asif Khan in 1633, this garden offers a serene retreat into history and nature.

title: Swami Lakshmanjoo Ashram – Gateway to Kashmiri Shaivism
excerpt: This ashram, dedicated to the revered Swami Lakshmanjoo, is a spiritual haven for seekers of Kashmiri Shaivism. Housing ancient texts, personal belongings of the master, and an extensive Shaivism library.
author: Rahul Khan
content: This ashram, dedicated to the revered Swami Lakshmanjoo, is a spiritual haven for seekers of Kashmiri Shaivism. Housing ancient texts, personal belongings of the master, and an extensive Shaivism library, the ashram serves as a portal to deep wisdom. Meditating here, surrounded by divine energy, is an opportunity for profound self-discovery and spiritual awakening.

title: The Sacred Valley: Hidden Treasures of Kashmir
excerpt: Discover our journey through the hidden valleys of Kashmir, where we found ancient shrines and unexpected moments of transcendence.
author: Aryan Sharma
content:
In the heart of Kashmir lies a hidden valley that few travelers ever discover. Our recent expedition took us deep into this sacred landscape, where we encountered ancient shrines and unexpected moments of spiritual transcendence.

The journey began at dawn, as we set out from Srinagar with our small group of seekers. The morning mist hung low over Dal Lake, creating an ethereal atmosphere that immediately set the tone for our journey. Our guide, a local Kashmiri who had spent decades exploring these remote regions, led us away from the usual tourist paths and into the embrace of the mountains.

The Forgotten Temple

By midday, we had reached a small village nestled between two towering peaks. Here, we discovered a temple that had stood for over five centuries, maintained by generations of the same family. The temple guardian, an elderly man with kind eyes and a gentle smile, welcomed us and shared stories of the miraculous events that had occurred there throughout history.

title: Following the Footsteps of Andrew Harvey in the Himalayas
excerpt: How the teachings of mystical scholar Andrew Harvey come alive when experienced in the magnificent setting of the Himalayan mountains.
author: Leila Patel
content:
When renowned mystical scholar Andrew Harvey first encountered the Himalayas, he described it as "coming home to the place where heaven and earth converse." Following his footsteps through these sacred mountains offers a profound opportunity to experience how landscape and spiritual teaching become one seamless experience.

Our recent retreat, guided by teachers deeply versed in Harvey's work, took participants on both an outer and inner journey through the majestic valleys and peaks that have inspired seekers for millennia.

Sacred Fire Practices

One evening, gathered around a sacred fire with the snow-capped peaks silhouetted against the darkening sky, we engaged in Harvey's transformative Fire Practice – a guided meditation that invokes the purifying and transformative qualities of flame as a metaphor for spiritual awakening.

title: Naranag – A Journey into Kashmir's Ancient Soul
excerpt: Naranag is an archeological and spiritual treasure, home to the 8th-century Shiva temples built by King Lalitaditya. This mystical valley, with its lush alpine meadows, gushing Wangath River, and ancient stone carvings.
author: Vikram Singh
content: Naranag is an archeological and spiritual treasure, home to the 8th-century Shiva temples built by King Lalitaditya. This mystical valley, with its lush alpine meadows, gushing Wangath River, and ancient stone carvings, holds the echoes of devotion from centuries past. A visit here is more than a historical tour—it is a pilgrimage into Kashmir's divine heritage.

title: The Art of Silence: Retreats by Dal Lake
excerpt: Our popular silent meditation retreats by the tranquil shores of Dal Lake offer a unique opportunity for deep inner work.
author: Rahul Khan
content:
In a world that never stops talking, silence has become a rare and precious commodity. Our silent meditation retreats on the tranquil shores of Dal Lake offer participants an immersion into the transformative power of silence – not as an absence, but as a living presence that can heal, renew, and awaken.

The Setting

We host these retreats on a private houseboat, traditionally known as a "doonga," that has been in the same Kashmiri family for five generations. Lovingly restored to balance authentic character with modern comforts, the houseboat creates a floating sanctuary where the gentle lapping of water becomes a natural sound meditation.

title: Kheer Bhawani Temple – The Changing Colors of Divinity
excerpt: Dedicated to Ragnya Devi, this revered temple is surrounded by a sacred spring that is believed to change colors, signaling divine omens. According to legend, Lord Rama himself worshipped the goddess here during his exile.
author: Priya Kapoor
content: Dedicated to Ragnya Devi, this revered temple is surrounded by a sacred spring that is believed to change colors, signaling divine omens. According to legend, Lord Rama himself worshipped the goddess here during his exile. Nestled among majestic deodar trees, the temple exudes an air of tranquility and mystery, making it a cherished stop for spiritual seekers.

title: Shankaracharya Temple – The Throne of Lord Shiva
excerpt: Perched atop the Takht-e-Suleiman (Throne of Solomon) hill, the Shankaracharya Temple offers panoramic views of Srinagar, Dal Lake, and the Jhelum River.
author: Aryan Sharma
content: Perched atop the Takht-e-Suleiman (Throne of Solomon) hill, the Shankaracharya Temple offers panoramic views of Srinagar, Dal Lake, and the Jhelum River. Believed to be the oldest temple in Kashmir, this sacred site is dedicated to Lord Shiva and has been a center of spiritual energy for thousands of years. The journey to its summit is as fulfilling as the prayers offered at its shrine.

title: Sufi Music Night – A Melodic Union with the Divine
excerpt: Under the open sky, the Sufi Music Night is a transcendent experience where pilgrims and locals gather to soak in the soul-stirring melodies of Rababs, Santoors, and mystical vocals.
author: Rahul Khan
content: Under the open sky, the Sufi Music Night is a transcendent experience where pilgrims and locals gather to soak in the soul-stirring melodies of Rababs, Santoors, and mystical vocals. Inspired by the poetry of Rumi, Hafiz, and Lalleshwari, this evening transports you into a state of blissful surrender, making it one of the most cherished highlights of the journey.
